text: I feel I am always a little confused about the dual "abstract / description" in the submission. And I don't really find any details about it. The "criteria for the reviews" only talks about "abstract" so is the "description" not included in that? And should the description be self standing or is the abstract assumed to be read before one reads the description?

text:
I can't speak authoritatively since not on program committee this year but from how Pretalx works:

Reviewer is shown abstract and description. (i think the CFP means abstract in a general sense rather than that particular field. CFP should be fixed)

Any where the description is shown the abstract is shown first.

Some places the abstract is shown the description is not shown.
So abstract should stand alone. Description doesn't have to.
